analysis
Class FixedPointApproximatorMT

java.lang.Object
  analysis.FixedPointApproximatorMT
public class FixedPointApproximatorMT
extends java.lang.Object

computes a Fixed-Point of a contraction mapping f:R^n -> R^n, using multiple threads. The use of multiple threads makes more sense when n is large, and/or the function components are hard to compute. The contraction mapping must be implemented as a thread-safe class (its evalCoord() method must be reentrant).

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

Method Detail

shutDownExecutor

public void shutDownExecutor()
                      throws ParallelException
shuts down the associated PDBatchTaskExecutor object. Once shut-down, the object cannot be used again to compute any function's fixed point.

Throws:
ParallelException

findFixedPoint

public VectorIntf findFixedPoint(VecFunctionIntf f,
                                 java.util.HashMap params,
                                 VectorIntf x0,
                                 long max_iters,
                                 double tol)
                          throws ParallelException
main method that computes the unique fixed point of the function -assuming the function is a contraction mapping.

Parameters:
f - VecFunctionIntf the contraction mapping whose fixed point must be computed.
params - HashMap any parameters used by the contraction mapping.
x0 - VectorIntf the initial point to kick-start the computations.
max_iters - long the maximum number of iterations allowed.
tol - double the maximum tolerance allowed in terms of || x - f(x) ||.
Returns:
VectorIntf the required fixed-point.
Throws:
ParallelException - if it fails to find a fixed point with the given arguments
